page.title: 04PUTTENHAM CHURCH
page.content: Puttenham has a very interesting church. The window commemorating the patron saint,{John the Baptist,}is now hidden behind the organ. Several years ago this was moved from its former place in the chancel to help the sound to reach the congregation. There is a brass memorial to{Edward Cranford, rector in 1400, wearing his vestments. Close by is a window with a lower light said to be a beggar's window. The kneelers were made by the women of the village about ten years ago. They are all different but made in the same colours. There are Jubilee pictures and sculptures given by local artists. In the church yard is a{well, discovered in 1972 when a tree disappeared from sight on Palm Sunday. It was used in 1735 to put out a fire which destroyed the church tower after spreading from the blacksmith's shop.
